reviewText: Yet another lazy mobile port. Resolution is locked at 1280 x 768. There are no rebindable keys, which if you are left handed like me, makes the game pretty much unplayable past the first few levels. Plus the game suffers from some of the worst screen tearing issues I have seen in a non-idtech game. You'd be much better off just playing this on mobile since no effort was made to make the port PC friendly.

reviewText: The definition of a functional game with nothing to offer. reviewText:
Poor game that tries to simulate an open level bomberman.

I've seen it in a few cheap bundles and I've got it in one of such bundles.

Let's try to point out why it is so bad:
- no tutorial whatsoever
- you can get powerups but there is no instruction what they do
- bombs work randomly - sometimes one bomb can work like AOE attack, sometimes it only kills one zombie even though others are basically standing on the same space as the first one. What's even better is that sometimes you can kill yourself just by throwing a bomb at zombie.
- graphics are really ugly
- no pause during game - if you hit escape you die

I've found one positive aspect of this game and it is:
- it has card drops

Really, nothing to do here.
----------
For anyone interested in joining in on completing your own backlog; check it out here - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog/discussions/5/530645446320364338/

reviewText:
Clergy Splode is a simple game about shooting bombs at zombies. You're supposed to kill a certain number of zombies, and get points, to go to the following levels.
But, the game can get pretty hard, a lot of zombies appear and you don't have much room to run, also, the way of letting go of the bomb is annoying and doesn't work well.
The game is not good, not fun, although pretty cheap. It won't give you many options and can be pretty much the same through the entire game. I also didn't like the esthetic, but it kinda mescles with the game's intention.
The sound is not good, also.
I don't recommend because I think it really doesn't try much to be good. But, if you insist, you may as well try, since you won't lose much of your money and, also, selling the trading cards that come with the game.

reviewText: Utter ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, don't touch this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ery. Run around on a tiny map n' throw bombs at zombies endlessly with increasingly ridiculous arbitrary goals that'll have you banging your head against the desk trying to complete one last task in a round, n' I only made it to level 6 out of 30. There's no appeal here, the only animation on the sprites are the feet, zombies will spawn directly on you while you're throwing bombs causing you to damage yourself, there's a lot of different zombies but none of them do anything different, and ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•ing trees. With most trees n' other inanimate objects in 2D games, you can walk behind the objects, but in this game the entire picture of an inanimate object is an obstruction. ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• this ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•, get your steam cards n' gtfo.

reviewText: Not a bad game. I think this game is worth the price when it's on sale. I got it for $0.14, and I'm enjoying the game. The music is repetitive, the controls are lackluster, and most importantly, there's NO tutorial or backstory. However, it's addictive, introduces cool powerups along the way, it looks nice for a cheap quickly-made game, and it's fun to play when you get bored.\n\nIf this game had a backstory, better controls, and better hitboxes, I'd say it'd be easily worth $5.00. Hopefully it gets updated or a sequel made.

reviewText: I don't know how to feel about this game. I've played the mobile version (which is free) and this game is exactly the same save the keyboard controls. I feel really cheated by the makers of the game for taking a free game and selling on steam for money. It's a huge offence. On the bright side side, the keyboard controls do amplify the game and make it far less annoying to play. Except for the fact that you still throw bombs in the direction you walk. This game needs a lot of things, a better menu, that's made for pc and you can scroll through using your arrow keys since you don't use the mouse in the game. Also, the controls aren't great. The music gets repetitive and the sound effects clash with it. The graphics are sub-par since it was taken directly from the mobile version. Controller support would be nice, along with maybe using WASD controls and the mouse to aim and fire as to improve controls. The gameplay isn't bad and is worth your 16 cents sale price, but the game does have problems that make it not worth the full price. This game needs a major update before it's worth full price, but I'm recommending it since the sale lasts for quite awhile :D

reviewText:
Even though I havn't played much of this game yet I instantly see it as one of those small little interesting games  that when you are bored and dont want to join people in the larger games you can just adventure to this. I will be using this alot at school, I do have a few suggestions though.

Change of font or text size
Ability to turn off sound effects
and A quick tutorial or backstory to see why or how am I meant to do this?

STILL I like that this game is the way it is. ( AS SEEN SO FAR) I will be using this one the next time I get spare time in class

reviewText:
hello everybody its me payde fore the clown bringing you another thrilling payde fore review!

the life of a priest is pretty exciting. everyday you get to turn boring old bread into the body of a 2000 year old zombie. what most people don't know is that jesus will give you special gifts if you earn his favor. for example, i get bundle game keys delivered to me on a regular basis from jesus's very own bundle stork.  in this game, jesus has chosen to gift one of his favorite priests with bombs!  these bombs are used to eradicate evil in the form of monsters, zombies and even unruly children!

after playing for a few minutes, i quickly realized that this is one of my favorite games of all time. clearly jesus himself has inspired this dev to make a perfect creation! god bless amen indeed my friends! i feel like i am getting at least $5000USD american value out of this game, despite its low low price making it the single greatest value on steam at the moment. my friends, i know i don't need to tell you this, but you owe it to both jesus and yourselves to give this game a try.

and oh the soundtrack! it features the single greatest piece of music that will ever do your speakers the honour of being played through them. i used to have a hearing problem, but my ears actually healed themselves in an attempt to better hear this brilliant work of music! get this game now, because once the word of its healing powers spreads, the price is sure to go up!

in closing, i give this game a rating of 17 stars out of 5, with an extra 3 stars for the soundtrack resulting in an astounding score of 27 stars out of 5. this game is truly a miracle of our time, and it can be enjoyed by humans, robots and animals equally. go ahead and ask mom and dad for their pocket change right now so you can convert it to internet dollars to buy this instant classic!

thanks for reading another payde fore review. feel free to check out the new payde fore curations group at http://steamcommunity.com/groups/PAYDEFORE for more games that have payde fore approval!

reviewText:
A cheap game (considering the quality of the game it's outrageously expensive) with bad graphics, no options menu and poor playability. This sad excuse of a browser game has nothing to do on Steam.

No joypad control?
No options screen?
No graphic or audio changes?
No redefinable keys? (guess what they are yourself)

So, that would be a no then.
